cwe_description: A program attempts to read data from a buffer using an index or pointer that is outside the bounds of the buffer.
explanation: The code uses `sg_set_page` to set the scatter-gather list entry. The offset is calculated as `offset_in_page(args->local_addr)`. If `args->local_addr` is not properly validated, it could lead to an out-of-bounds access when calculating the offset. Specifically, if `args->local_addr` is greater than or equal to the page size (4096 bytes), `offset_in_page` will return a large value, potentially causing `sg_set_page` to write beyond the bounds of the allocated page. The check `if (args->local_addr & 0x7)` only checks for 8-byte alignment, but does not prevent `args->local_addr` from being larger than the page size.

cwe_description: A program attempts to read data from a buffer using an index or pointer that is outside the bounds of the buffer.
explanation: The code uses `sg_set_page` to set the scatter-gather list entry. The offset is calculated as `offset_in_page(args->local_addr)`. If `args->local_addr` is not properly validated, it could lead to an out-of-bounds access when calculating the offset. Specifically, if `args->local_addr` is greater than or equal to `PAGE_SIZE`, `offset_in_page` will return a large value, potentially exceeding the maximum allowed offset for `sg_set_page`, leading to a kernel panic or other undefined behavior. The check `if (args->local_addr & 0x7)` only ensures 8-byte alignment, but does not prevent `args->local_addr` from being greater than or equal to `PAGE_SIZE`.
